attributes.action: Release a transparent budget for the restoration of the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: The government recently announced the need for the Palace of Westminster to be restored due to deteriorating conditions. Historical renovation is understandably costly but I feel the importance to know that this substantial amount of tax payer money is going to the right places for the right cost.

rejection.details:
Parliament has not yet agreed to the restoration of the Palace of Westminster, or which restoration option to adopt. Therefore this is currently no budget to release. You could create a petition calling on Parliament to release a budget once a way forward has been agreed, which we would be able to approve.  

The Joint Committee on the Palace of Westminster published its report on 8 September which set out the options for restoring the Palace, as well as  recommenced way forward. Their report can be found here: 

http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/joint-select/joint-committee-on-the-palace-of-westminster/news-parliament-2015/restoration-of-palace-of-westminster-report-published-16-17/ 

The report recommended that, once both Houses have agreed in principle to the restoration, a Delivery Authority be created  This Delivery Authority will then be responsible for producing a budget for the works.
